alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued July 26 at 8:50PM MST until July 26 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 849 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Chui-Chu to near Magma, moving northwest at 50 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 165 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 158 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 202 and 212. Locations impacted include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Gold Canyon, Sun Lakes, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, Gold Camp, San Tan Valley, and Seville. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
